DOC.brief_summary: The objective study evaluate association positive end-expiratory pressure ( PEEP ) set cardiac function , measure cardiac index , patient acute respiratory distress syndrome ( ARDS ) manage NHLBI ARDS Network Fluid Catheter Treatment Trial ( FACTT ) fluid protocol .
DOC.brief_title: The Relationship Between Positive End Expiratory Pressure Cardiac Index Patients With Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome ( ARDS ) Managed Fluid Protocol
DOC.detailed_description: This secondary cross-sectional analysis FACTT multi-center randomize control trial enrol adult patient within 48 hour ARDS onset twenty medical center across US , include one hospital . We study patient randomized pulmonary artery catheter arm FACTT study . The investigator include patient PEEP cardiac index measurement perform within short period first 3 day FACTT study enrollment . Since FACTT 2x2 factorial design , half patient 'liberal fluid ' study arm , half 'conservative fluid ' study arm .
DOC.criteria: Acute lung injury diagnosis ( define The American European Consensus Conference ARDS ) < 48 hour duration . Patients Pulmonary Artery catheter ( PAC ) arm FACTT study . PaO2 / FiO2 ratio < 200 . Data first 3 day mechanical ventilation . Select chronic condition could independently influence survival ( e.g. , expect 6month survival < 50 % ) / ventilator wean . PEEP value miss . FiO2 value miss . PaO2 value miss . Cardiac index value miss Pressors / inotropes requirement .
